Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has plenty of water and light, showing that it is healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough water, showing how it looks when it cannot live or grow well.
The student can draw a plant that does not have enough light, showing how it looks when it cannot live or grow well.
The student can use observations of real or media examples to represent how plants need water and light to live and grow.
The student can illustrate the pattern that plants need water and light to live by comparing healthy and unhealthy plants in their drawings.
